summary: This is an FBI Crisis Intake document dated July 7, 2019, reporting a tip received by the National Threat Operations Center. The tipster states that in 2007, a former girlfriend told him she had obtained a list of Jeffrey Epstein's close contacts and associates while on a trip to his private island, and that she would be in trouble if Epstein knew she had it.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The document is a crisis intake report concerning Jeffrey Epstein and child sex trafficking. The tip received involves information about his close contacts and associates.

events.title: Former girlfriend obtains Epstein's contact list
events.description: A woman, described as a former girlfriend of the tipster, reportedly obtained a copy of Jeffrey Epstein's list of close contacts and associates while on a trip to his private island. She confided that if Epstein knew she had the list, she would be in a lot of trouble.

events.title: FBI receives tip about Epstein contact list
events.description: The FBI's National Threat Operations Center receives a call from a tipster reporting information from 2007 about a former girlfriend who possessed a list of Epstein's associates.

keyFacts: On July 7, 2019, the FBI received a tip via the National Threat Operations Center (NTOC) regarding Jeffrey Epstein.
The tipster reported that in 2007, a former girlfriend told him she had obtained a list of all of Jeffrey Epstein's close contacts and associates.
The former girlfriend reportedly obtained the list during a trip to Epstein's private island, where she was romantically involved with him at the time.
The former girlfriend stated that if Epstein knew she had the list, 'she would be in a lot of trouble.'
The tipster had not spoken with the former girlfriend since 2007 but recently found her on Facebook, prompting the report.
